screens.headline: The decision that defines your trading style
screens.text: High probability + low profit? Or low probability + high profit? Choose wisely.

screens.headline: Strike selection = Probability selection
screens.text: Every strike price has an implied probability of being ITM at expiration. OTM strikes have low probability but high payoff. ITM strikes have high probability but low payoff. You're essentially choosing: Do I want to win often or win big?

screens.headline: Playing it safe vs swinging for the fences
screens.text: Imagine you're a hitter in baseball. You can: A) Bunt - 80% success rate, you get on base but no glory. B) Swing for home run - 20% success rate, but when you connect, you're a hero. Neither is 'better.' Bunters rack up steady base hits. Home run hitters have highlight reels but more strikeouts. Same choice in spreads.

reveal_sections.label: Bunt = OTM credit spreads (high probability)
reveal_sections.content: Consistent small wins with occasional losses.

reveal_sections.label: Home run = ITM debit spreads (high reward)
reveal_sections.content: Lower win rate but explosive gains when correct.

reveal_sections.label: Match strategy to your personality
reveal_sections.content: Conservative traders prefer high probability. Aggressive traders prefer high reward.

cards.definition: OTM credit spreads, narrow width, modest profit
cards.example: Sell $95 put on $100 stock - high chance of success

cards.definition: ATM spreads, moderate width, balanced risk/reward
cards.example: Buy $100 call, sell $110 call on $100 stock

cards.definition: OTM debit spreads, wide width, huge payoff if right
cards.example: Buy $100 call, sell $130 call on $100 stock
0.30 delta call = ~30% chance of expiring ITM

screens.question: AAPL at $180. You sell a bull put spread: Sell $170 put, Buy $160 put. What's your approximate probability of profit?
screens.explanation_correct: Yes! The $170 put is $10 OTM (~5-6% away). Stocks rarely drop >5% in a month, so this is high-probability. Expect 70-80% win rate over time.
screens.explanation_wrong: When you sell puts $10 OTM (~5-6% below current price), you're taking the 'likely' side of the bet. Most months, stocks don't fall that much. High probability = 70-80% win rate.

screens.question: You expect NVDA to rally from $500 to $550+. Which bull call spread matches this conviction?
screens.explanation_correct: Perfect! When you expect a BIG move ($500â†’$550+), go with wide spreads and high payoff. You have conviction, so trade accordingly. This is a lower probability play but huge reward if right.
screens.explanation_wrong: Strong conviction = wider spreads with bigger profit potential. Selling the $550 call caps you right at your target - not ideal. Sell the $600 call to capture more upside if your thesis is correct.

screens.headline: Compare three strategies
screens.description: SPY at $450, all expiring in 45 days. See how probability affects profit potential.

outputs.label: Option A: High Probability
outputs.value: Sell $440 put, Buy $430 put | Collect $3 | Risk $7 | Max profit $300 | Prob ~75% | BE $437

outputs.label: Option B: Balanced
outputs.value: Buy $450 call, Sell $460 call | Pay $5 | Risk $500 | Max profit $500 | Prob ~50% | BE $455

outputs.label: Option C: Low Probability
outputs.value: Buy $450 call, Sell $480 call | Pay $10 | Risk $1,000 | Max profit $2,000 | Prob ~30% | BE $460

teaching_points: Option A wins 75/100 times but makes $300 each
Option C wins 30/100 times but makes $2,000 each
Long-term expected value can be similar, but emotional experience very different

cards.back: Sell OTM puts/calls 5-10% away. Narrow width. Win 65-75% of time. Small profits. Good for income traders.
ATM strikes, moderate width. Win 45-55% of time. Even risk/reward. Good for neutral strategies.
Wide debit spreads, aggressive targets. Win 25-40% of time. Big winners when right. For strong conviction trades.
Conservative â†’ high prob. Risk-tolerant â†’ low prob. Most successful traders pick one style and master it.
